item.title: Debian and Ubuntu packages
item.description: I'm happy to announce that source and binary packages are now available for both Debian Sid and Ubuntu 13.04 "Raring Ringtail". Thanks go out to the respective maintainers!

item.title: pepper 0.3.2 released
item.description: I'm happy to announce that version 0.3.2 of pepper is now available. This release fixes compilation with GCC 4.7 as well as some minor memory leaks. As usual, you can find source tarballs the Download section.

item.title: peprserv - A repository statistics server for pepper
item.description:
I've just pushed the first version of a repository statistics server to GitHub. peprserv is actually a Lua report script for pepper, utilizing the Xavante HTTP web server. The main intention for this project is providing a backend for serving repository statistics to other web applications, like repository interfaces or bug trackers.

A live demo using the official Git repository is running at http://jgehring.net:9000, and the source code is available on GitHub.

item.title: pepper 0.3.1 released
item.description:
I'm happy to announce that version 0.3.1 of pepper is now available. This release brings the usual fixes as well as new features. Experimental support for using LevelDB as a backend for the revision cache has been added. The built-in Gnuplot interface received a function for pie charts, which is already used by the new authors_pie report and the new --pie flag for the filetypes report. Furthermore, there's a new report called volume which closely resembles the commit volume report from Ohloh.

The list of bugs that have been fixed in this release includes an issue that broke plotting on Mac OS X and some headless environments. Repository detection for working copies handled with Subversion 1.7 has been fixed, too.

A more detailed listing of the changes can be found in the change log, source tarballs are available at the Download section.

The Gallery has been updated with new examples, now using a pretty Gnuplot style based on this GuidoLabs article.

item.title: pepper 0.3 released
item.description:
Version 0.3 of pepper is now available. This release features an improved report API, a new report for running other reports from a graphical user interface and numerous bugfixes and smaller improvements.

The report API has received a big update. In particular, the ability to access and run other reports from within the current report has been improved. Among other things, this enables the creation of meta-reports that aggregate existing reports. These features are also heavily used by the new GUI report.

NOTE: This update breaks compatibility with existing scripts. However, the changes required to make old reports working have been kept small and are described in detail in the respective porting guide.

A more detailed listing of the changes can be found in the change log. As usual, source tarballs can be found at the Download section.

item.title: pepper 0.2.4 released
item.description:
I'm happy to announce that version 0.2.4 of pepper is now available. This is a bugfix release only, fixing a file name issue reported by Merve Yüzbaşıoğlu, that could cause errors when running the program against sub-directories of Subversion repositories. Additionally, some minor fixes have been made to the age report.

A more detailed listing of the changes can be found in the change log. As usual, source tarballs can be found at the Download section.

item.title: pepper 0.2.3 released
item.description:
I'm happy to announce that version 0.2.3 of pepper is now available. This release adds the punchcard report, inspired by GitHub's punchcard and Git Timecard. Additionally, a major glitch preventing the Subversion backend to work on empty caches has been fixed (#3314428, thanks to Daniel Lynes for reporting!).

A more detailed listing of the changes can be found in the change log. As usual, source tarballs can be found at the Download section.

item.title: pepper 0.2.2 released
item.description:
Version 0.2.2 of pepper is now available. This release greatly improves the performance of the Git backend and adds two built-in report scripts. One of them, the participation report, is on display at the Gallery.

A more detailed listing of the changes can be found in the change log. As usual, source tarballs can be found at the Download section.

item.title: pepper 0.2.1 released
item.description:
Version 0.2.1 of pepper is now available. This release focuses on the Subversion backend implementation and contains new features as well as bugfixes. The revision log for Subversion repositories is now cached locally, resulting in a noticeable speedup for subsequent reports on remote repositories. Furthermore, a working copy can now be used for the repository URL. The bugfixes include several Subversion-related issues, including possibly missing diffstats for deleted files and problems with subdirectory handling.

A more detailed listing of the changes can be found in the change log. As usual, source tarballs can be found at the Download section.

item.title: pepper 0.2 released
item.description:
Version 0.2 of pepper is now available. This release brings new and improved built-in reports, an overhauled report API and a man page. The Mercurial activity extension has been ported to pepper. The commits_per_month report has been generalized and renamed to commit_counts and a report that dumps commit data in CSV format has been added. The new man page is also available here.

A more detailed listing of the changes can be found in the change log. As usual, source tarballs can be found at the Download section.

The homepage has been updated as well. On the right, the latest commits from pepper's GitHub repository are shown, and the scripting guide as well as the Gallery page have been updated. I've added a favicon representing a pepper box and changed some of the colors.

item.title: pepper 0.1.5 released
item.description:
Version 0.1.5 of pepper is now available. This release adds a new report showing a histogram of file types in the repository. The command-line argument for the repository can be omitted now to use the current directory. Additionally, the cache check is now performed by the new built-in check_cache report. Two bugs reported by Dominik Geyer have been fixed (see #3162914 and #3162922).

Please refer to the change log for a more detailed listing. As usual, source tarballs can be found at the Download section.

item.title: pepper 0.1.4 released
item.description:
Version 0.1.4 of pepper is now available. This release adds additional report options for controlling the plot output, like the file name or the image size. Additionally, support for custom Subversion repository layouts (trunk, branches and tag locations) has been added. A couple of bugs have been fixed as well.

Please refer to the change log for a more detailed listing. As usual, source tarballs can be found at the Download section.

item.title: pepper 0.1.3 released
item.description:
pepper 0.1.3 is now available. This release adds a new report for visualizing directory sizes and fixes several major bugs, including wrong diff calls for merged revisions in the Git and Mercurial backend. Diffstat data generated previously may be wrong, so old revision caches will be invalidated automatically.

Please refer to the change log for a more detailed listing.

As usual, source tarballs can be found at the Download section. The Gallery page has been updated, so you can take a look at the new report script.

item.title: AUR package
item.description:
I've added a PKGBUILD for pepper to the Arch User Repository. Arch users can install the program now using their favorite AUR package manager, e.g. yaourt -S scm-pepper.

In order to add support for all available repository types, the subversion and mercurial packages should be installed first.

item.title: pepper-0.1.2
item.description:
pepper 0.1.2 is now available. This release adds tag access for reports scripts and fixes several bugs. The tags and branches listing of Subversion repositories accessed via http:// has been fixed, and the signal handling code for protecting cache writes has been rewritten.

As usual, source tarballs can be found at the Download section.

item.title: New Homepage
item.description:
I'm happy to announce that pepper's homepage is now generated using IkiWiki, a nifty wiki compiler. The homepage has been split into categories now, a navigation bar can be found on top of the index page. There's also a lot of new content, including documentation and a small scripting guide.

The source code of the website is available at GitHub.

item.title: pepper-0.1.1
item.description:
pepper 0.1.1 is now available. This release adds a new report showing commit times in a scatter plot and fixes several bugs. Among others, running built-in reports without specifying the full path and several issues related to multi-threading have been fixed. The Lua detection of the configure script should work automatically for most Linux distributions now.

Source tarballs can be found at the Download section.
